result.execSummary:
The defendant Daryl Hayse was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Waukesha County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: May transfer probation to Milwaukee County.  Sentence credit of 3 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.

Inform Agent of all prescriptions.  Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done. Surcharge imposed.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daryl Hayse

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
Wis. Dept. of Corrections notice of case status change received.  Outstanding financial obligations have been converted to a civil judgment.

Notice of Court Ordered Financial Obligations Status
Discharge date: 03/07/17
records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.   State gives sentencing recommendation.  Attorney Morin makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR  (3 days credit, if revoked)   **Transfer allowed to Milwaukee County**

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
____No Use or Possession of llegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Inform Agent of all prescriptions
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done 

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
Plea/sentencing hearing at 03-07-2016 03:00 pm

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Morin requests another plea/sentencing hearing for the Defendant to complete his alcohol assesment. State has no objection.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for March 7, 2016 at 03:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 01-07-2016 01:30 pm

Case called at 8:45 a.m.  Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Daryl Hayse did not appear.   Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin does not know why Defendant does not appear.  State requests a capias. Court issues a capias.  Bail is ordred revoked and forfeited.

Case re-called at 8:55 a.m..  Defendant now appears.  All other appearances remain the same.  Court quashes capias and re-instates bail.  Attorney Morin requests a plea and sentence date.  Court adjourns for plea and sentence.    Bail remains as fixed.
Hearing at 11-04-2015 08:30 am

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Case called for Motion hearing. Village of Pewaukee Officer Matthew DePrey sworn-in and testifies for the State. Cross examination by Atty Morin. Re-direct by the State. Re-cross by Atty Morin. Defendant is sworn-in and testifies for the Defense. Cross examination by the State. No redirect. Testimony closed. Closing statements by the State. Closing statements by Atty Morin. Motion is denied.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for November 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Hearing returned, for hearing scheduled on: 09/30/15.
Motion hearing at 09-30-2015 10:00 am

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Andrea M. Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case was set for motion hearing, however the state is requesting an adjournment as one of their witnesses is not available.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 30, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Motion hearing on August 26, 2015 at 10:00 am.
(Orig.) ... to suppress fruits of illegal search. Filed by Atty Morin.
Hearing on August 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with Attorney Kelsey Morin.  Michele W. Hulgaard appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin provides proof of Defendant's vehicle being a total loss and therefore not able to come to court at last court date.  Attorney Morin states she will be filing a motion to suppress within the next 2 weeks.  Court sets deadline of 7/2/15 to file such motion.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for August 3, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Hearing on June 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Attorney Kelsey Morin in court.   Defendant Daryl Hayse did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Morin states that Defendant called her stating he was in an auto accident and won't be here today.    Court ordered a capias stayed until next court date.  Defendant to provide proof of auto accident at next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 25, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Hearing on June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court with attorney Reisha Mitchell for attorney Kelsey Morin.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for June 8, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Preliminary hearing on April 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Not to change his address unless he gives written premission.   Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Daryl Hayse in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Morin.   Kevin M. Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant is eligible for State Public Defender representation.  An attorney will be appointed.  Preliminary Hearing requested  Preliminary time limits waived.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:15 am.
